thread.title: Live Devon and Cornwall traffic, weather and news on September 12 - Devon Live

author: Neil Shaw
title: Live Devon and Cornwall traffic, weather and news on September 12 - Devon Live
text:
News Live Devon and Cornwall traffic, weather and news on September 12
Live traffic, travel and news updates from the M5, A30, and A38 - and bringing you the news from Penzance and Truro to Plymouth, Exeter, Bideford and beyond Share Neil Shaw Head of Digital, live and trending for PlymouthLive, DevonLive and CornwallLive Updated News Heavy traffic on the link road (Image: Ian Farrer)
Welcome to our breaking news service - the only place you can get all of latest news and traffic, travel and weather updates for Devon and Cornwall.
We'll keep you updated on everything that's happening on the major roads around the region - and how traffic is moving in major towns and the key cities of Plymouth, Exeter and Truro. Our dedicated breaking news team will have their eyes on every major route in the South West.
We'll also keep you updates with the major news developments during the day. This is where you will hear first about all the breaking news - from crime and traffic to major investigations and politics .
If there's a story we're missing then please , message us on Facebook or call our newsroom on 01752 293 100. Want more news?
To keep up to date with Plymouth Live's latest news, follow us on Facebook here and Twitter here , or visit our homepage at www.plymouthlive.com
For Devon news, find Devon Live's Facebook page here , or our Twitter page here , or visit our homepage at www.devonlive.com
For Cornwall news, find Cornwall Live's Facebook page here , or our Twitter page here , or visit our r homepage at www.cornwalllive.com Key Events A377 blocked by Jack-knifed lorry between Exeter and Crowley
SAINT ANDREW’S ROAD - COWLEY - BOTH DIRECTIONS - DEVON
Saint Andrew’s Road in both directions blocked, slow traffic due to broken down lorry between A377 Cowley Hill (Cowley) and Kinnerton Way (Exeter).A lorry has become stuck after trying to turn around in the road. PLYMOUTH A38 crash causing delays in Plymouth
A38 THE PARKWAY - PLYMOUTH - EASTBOUND - DEVON
Reports of slow traffic due to accident, two vehicles involved on A38 The Parkway Eastbound between B3413 (Forder Valley Interchange) and A374 (Marsh Mills Roundabout). CORNWALL Mevagissey pub landlord Lee Young fined for refusing to reveal crab meat origins
A pub landlord has been ordered to pay more than £3,500, because he refused to reveal where his crab meat came from.
Lee Young, 58 of the Ship Inn, Mevagissey, received an £800 fine and was ordered to pay Council costs of £2,731 after he pleaded guilty to obstruction and failing to ensure adequate labelling to facilitate traceability at Bodmin Magistrates Court on 6 September.
During the hearing, magistrates heard that during a routine food inspection in June this year, food officers from Cornwall Council discovered unlabelled frozen and chilled cooked white crab meat which had come from an unknown source. Car seized in Truro after illegal driver tests positive for drugs PLYMOUTH Laira Bridge Road crash cleared
A379 LAIRA BRIDGE ROAD - PLYMOUTH - OUTBOUND - DEVON
Road cleared and traffic returned to normal, accident cleared on A379 Laira Bridge Road Outbound between Embankment Lane and Pomphlett Road. PLYMOUTH A379 Laira Bridge Road still partially blocked
A379 LAIRA BRIDGE ROAD - PLYMOUTH - OUTBOUND - DEVON
A379 Laira Bridge Road Outbound partially blocked, slow traffic due to accident, two vehicles involved between Embankment Lane and Pomphlett Road. 15:34 Lorry firm statement after A38 death CORNWALL A38 crash cleared
A38 - SALTASH - EASTBOUND - CORNWALL
All lanes open, recovery work completed and accident cleared on A38 Eastbound between A388 (Carkeel Roundabout) and B3271 ( Tamar Bridge). Lane two (of two) remains closed of the eastbound carriageway for recovery work. Lane two was briefly closed westbound to inspect barrier damage before being re-opened shortly afterwards. CORNWALL Cornwall residents urged to prepare for environmental disaster
People in Cornwall are being urged to prepare for an environmental disaster.
The county has been highlighted as the area of the South West most at risk in a study about disaster risks, thanks to increasingly ferocious storms.
And its residents are being urged to create preparedness plans and aer being advised on what to do during a prolonged and devastating power cut. Delays on road to Truro
A390 - TRELISKE - CORNWALL
Reports of slow traffic due to traffic light failure on A390 at Chyvelah Vale (Maiden Green Roundabout). Approach with care.The traffic lights at the roundabout are reported to be out. 14:01 Plymouth MP's message to Prime Minister CORNWALL Crash on A38 at Carkeel
A38 - SALTASH - EASTBOUND - CORNWALL
One lane closed and slow traffic due to accident, a car and lorry involved on A38 Eastbound between A388 (Carkeel Roundabout) and B3271 (Tamar Bridge). A38 lorry cleared
A38 - BODMIN - NORTHBOUND - CORNWALL
A38 Northbound now passable, traffic easing, broken down lorry removed near Bodmin Parkway Train Station. Traffic is taking it in turns to pass the scene. NEWS Wetherspoon pubs are banning Jagerbombs to support Brexit
Pro-Leave pub giant company JD Wetherspoon will stop serving Jagerbombs later this month - to support Brexit
The chain, which has branches across Devon and Cornwall, has announced lower prices across its 880 pubs from September 26 - and says the move is part of a plan to increase its range of drinks from UK and non-EU.
The pubs are axing Jagermeister (a herbal liqueur from Germany) traditionally mixed with an energy drink like Red Bull to make the popular ‘Jagerbomb’ drink. It will be replaced with Strika, a herbal liqueur produced in England instead. A38 blocked by lorry near Bodmin Parkway
A38 - BODMIN - NORTHBOUND - CORNWALL A38
Northbound just passable, very slow traffic due to broken down lorry near Bodmin Parkway Train Station.Traffic is taking it in turns to pass the scene. DEVON Teenage tractor driver admits killing gran driving home from Slimming World
A teenage tractor driver from Devon killed a grandmother of two when his trailer - which was later found to have 17 defects - became detached and smashed into her car.
Jack Retter , now 21, had only just bought the trailer, and was towing it home when a spring came loose and it detached and smashed into Carol Broxholme, 59.
Grandmother-of-two Carol was killed, and her daughter Sherryann, who was 25 at the time, was rushed to hospital with life-threatening injuries.
Tests later revealed that the faulty tractor trailer has 17 defects, and should not have been on the road.
Retter, of Monkton, Devon, who was 19 at the time of the incident on March 9, 2017, had denied charges of causing death by dangerous driving and causing injury by dangerous driving. But he changed his plea and admitted both charges before his trial was due to start at Taunton Crown Court on Tuesday. Queueing traffic on A39
A39 - SAINT KEW HIGHWAY - BOTH DIRECTIONS - CORNWALL
Slow traffic on A39 in both directions at Saint Kew Gold Course. In the roadworks area.Temporary traffic lights are in operation.
A39 PARKA ROAD - TREKENNING - BOTH DIRECTIONS - CORNWALL
Queueing traffic and delays on A39 Parka Road in both directions from A3059 (Trekenning Roundabout, Trekenning) to A392 (Halloon Roundabout, Black Cross). In the roadworks area.Temporary lights are causing delays. PLYMOUTH Man, 33, in custody after fatal crash on A38 near Plymouth
POLICE STATEMENT
A woman has died following a two vehicle collision on the A38 near Leigham, Plymouth on Tuesday 11 September.
Police were notified at around 6.30pm of the incident which happened on the Eastbound Carriageway and involved a Heavy Goods Vehicle (HGV) and an Audi A4.
It was reported that the driver of the Audi, a 54-year-old woman was struck in the collision. She was located officers at the scene and given first aid.
The 54-year-old woman was later confirmed deceased at the scene. Her next of kin are aware and are being supported by a Family Liaison Officer.
A 33-year-old man from Plymouth was arrested on suspicion of causing death by dangerous driving. He remains in police custody for questioning.
Emergency services attended the scene and the road was closed for over eight hours. Officers would like to thank the public for their patience whist the investigation was carried out at the scene.
Police are appealing for witnesses and anyone with information to contact police on 101@dc.police.uk or call 101 quoting log 746 11 September. 11:00 Traffic slow at St Kew 10:44
